reviews.text:
I have only used Warminster station a couple of times, but it is fairly close to the town itself

Access is via a foot bridge, though not too sure if disabled access via the road on the car park side 

Taxis normally waiting by the station entrance to the town

It always appears to be tidy and clean and have normally used it in the evening

it is served by great Western railway trains (Cardiff to Portsmouth hourly service in each direction - and mid way between Salisbury and Westbury for connections further afield - (the occasional train goes through to Brighton  or a little and occasional service from Warminster to Frome via Westbury

Also  occasionally served by South Western Railway and services to Bristol/Waterloo or Yeovil/London

As with all things check train times before departure

Ticket machines on both platforms for when the ticket office is shut 

No services available when the ticket office is closed

Happy travelling

No facilities open if you arrive on a Sunday. Travelling home on the following Friday was unable to access toilet facilities.Lady in ticket office had locked them until the last train used by school children had left the station. The children were the most well behaved bunch i had seen and not what i had expected!!
The ticket office lady was not very pleasant when i asked a couple of times if i could use the toilet faclities. 
These facilities are supposed to be made available for all station users. 
Not just when it suits.
I have only used Warminster Station a few times but i have never had a problem, the staff are always friendly and it appears to be clean and tidy.
